required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells Targeting claudin18.2 in Solid Tumors.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Lable, Dose Escalating/Dose Regimen Finding Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Efficacy, and Cytokinetics of Autologous Humanized Anti-claudin18.2 Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cell in Advanced Solid Tumor Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: An open label, dose escalating/dose regimen finding clinical study to evaluate the safety, efficacy, and pharmacokinetics of autologous humanized anti-claudin18.2 chimeric antigen receptor T cell in advanced solid tumor.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is an open, multiple infusion, dose escalation/dose regimen finding study to assess the safety and pharmacokinetics of CAR-CLDN18.2 T cell therapy, and to obtain the preliminary efficacy results in subjects who have been diagnosed with advanced solid tumor with positive claudin 18.2 expression and failed to standard systemic treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (the number of cell copies and cell persistence duration in peripheral blood)
secondary_outcome.description: CAR-CLDN18.2 DNA in peripheral blood detected by q-PCR at each visit after infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events occurring through 26 weeks and 12 months post infusion of CAR-CLDN18.2 T-Cell infusion, such as abnormalities or changes in laboratory examinations, physical examinations, vital signs, etc.
The period from the day when the subject receives the infusion of cells to the first recorded tumor progression (whether treated or not) or death of any cause, which occurs first.
The period from the first evaluation of CR or PR to the first evaluation of PD or death of any cause
The period from the first evaluation of clinical benefit to the first evaluation of PD or any cause of death.
The period from the first infusion to any cause of death

The number of cases in which tumor size is reduced to PR or CR / the total number of evaluable cases (%). In the event of PR or CR, the subjects should confirm it no less than 4 weeks after the first evaluation
The number of cases in which response are achieved from the start of cell infusion/the total number of evaluable cases (%).

arm_group.description: The subjects enrolled will be sequentially assigned to the corresponding dose level.

intervention.description: Pretreatment with fludarabine, cyclophosphamide, • Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells Targeting Claudin18.2
intervention.other_name: Chimeric Antigen Receptor T Cells Targeting Claudin18.2

facility.name: Department of GI Oncology, Peking University Cancer Hospital
